Trial_Design.evidence: This prospective randomized controlled double-blind trial included 116 patients

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to either the SGB group ( n = 40) or control group ( n = 39), with the latter receiving no SGB

Objective.evidence: The objective of the study was to assess the clinical utility of ultrasound-guided SGB in patients undergoing thoracoscopic pulmonary lobectomy

Method_Outcome.evidence: Hemodynamics using oxygenation index (OI) and the pulmonary shunt fraction (Qs/Qt), respiratory mechanics using dynamic lung compliance (Cdyn) and mean airway pressure (P mean ), and levels of pro-inflammatory factors (IL-6 and IL-8) were assessed as clinical outcomes after surgery

Number_Randomised.evidence: 116 patients who underwent SLV. After exclusion, 88 patients were randomly assigned

Number_Analysed.evidence: randomly assigned to either the SGB group ( n = 40) or control group ( n = 39)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Compared to the control group, the SGB group demonstrated significantly decreased P mean , Qs/Qt, IL-6, and IL-8 and increased Cdyn and OI

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was registered in the Chinese Clinical Trial Registry (#ChiCTR2200063210)
